N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 250.2 - General policies on discipline of incarcerated individuals

State Regulations
(a) It
is the policy of the department to eliminate, mitigate, and respond to
disparities so as to ensure a fair and equitable distribution of benefits and
burdens in the placement of incarcerated individuals in housing unit
assignments, institutional work assignments, and programs; and the proper post
release supervision of parolees to include, but not be limited to, supervision
level, violation processes, and early discharge/merit terminations. Moreover, it is the department's policy that any administrative processes associated with
any incarcerated individual or parolee who may be subject to discipline and
grievances are conducted fairly to ensure that decisions are not influenced by
stereotypes or biases based on age, race, creed, color, national origin, sexual
orientation, military status, sex, disability, predisposing genetic
characteristics, familial status, marital status or domestic violence victim
status. To do so, the department shall provide ongoing staff training, monitoring, and auditing systems to ensure compliance with all provisions of
this policy. The department shall develop programs to help incarcerated
individuals work and live together regardless of their identity and
backgrounds. Notes
